questions.statement: What does SQL stand for?
With SQL, how do you select all the records from a table named "Persons" where the "FirstName" is "FreeTime" and the "LastName" is "FreeTime"?

options.text: SELECT \* FROM Persons WHERE FirstName<>'FreeTime' AND LastName<>'Learning'
SELECT \* FROM Persons WHERE FirstName='FreeTime' AND LastName='Learning'

questions.statement: With SQL, how do you select all the records from a table named "Persons" where the "LastName" is alphabetically between (and including) "FreeTime" and "Learning"?

options.text: SELECT \* FROM Persons WHERE LastName BETWEEN 'FreeTime' AND 'Learning'
SELECT LastName>'FreeTime' AND LastName<'Learning' FROM Persons
SELECT \* FROM Persons WHERE LastName>'FreeTime' AND LastName<'Learning'

questions.statement: Which SQL statement is used to extract data from a database?
Which SQL statement is used to update data in a database?
Which SQL statement is used to delete data from a database?
Which SQL statement is used to return only different values?
Which SQL keyword is used to sort the result-set?
With SQL, how can you return all the records from a table named "Persons" sorted descending by "FirstName"?

options.text: SELECT * FROM Persons ORDER BY FirstName DESC
SELECT * FROM Persons SORT BY 'FirstName' DESC
SELECT * FROM Persons ORDER FirstName DESC

questions.statement: Which SQL statement is used to insert new data in a database?
What is returned by INSTR(‘FREETIMELEARN’, ‘M’)?
Which of the following is not true about Natural Joins?

options.text: Natural join is based on all columns in two tables having same name
It selects rows from the two tables having different values in the matched columns.
If columns having same names have different data types, it returns error.

questions.statement: With SQL, how do you select a column named "FirstName" from a table named "Persons"?
With SQL, how do you select all the columns from a table named "Persons"?
With SQL, how can you insert a new record into the "Persons" table?
With SQL, how can you insert "Ramana" as the "LastName" in the "Persons" table?
Which of the following is true about a group function?

options.text: Group functions operate on sets of rows to produce multiple results per group.
DISTINCT keyword makes a group function consider duplicate values.

questions.statement: Which of the following query will result in an error?

options.text: select dept\_id, avg(salary) from employees group by dept\_id;
select avg(salary) from employees group by dept\_id;
select dept\_id, job\_id, avg(salary) from employees group by dept\_id, job\_id;

questions.statement: Which of the following is not true about removing rows from a table?

options.text: You can use a subquery in a DELETE statement.
Specific rows are deleted based on the WHERE clause condition.
A statement like, DELETE , would cause deletion of the table from the database.

questions.statement: How can you change "Ramana" into "Suresh" in the "LastName" column in the Persons table?

options.text: MODIFY Persons SET LastName='Suresh' WHERE LastName='Ramana'
UPDATE Persons SET LastName='Suresh' WHERE LastName='Ramana'
UPDATE Persons SET LastName='Ramana' INTO LastName='Suresh'
MODIFY Persons SET LastName='Ramana' INTO LastName='Suresh

questions.statement: With SQL, how do you select all the records from a table named "Persons" where the value of the column "FirstName" is "Reddy"?

options.text: SELECT \[all\] FROM Persons WHERE FirstName LIKE 'Reddy'

questions.statement: With SQL, how do you select all the records from a table named "Persons" where the value of the column "FirstName" starts with an "a"?

options.text: SELECT \* FROM Persons WHERE FirstName LIKE '%a'
SELECT \* FROM Persons WHERE FirstName LIKE 'a%'

questions.statement: What type of query gets information from a database?
What type of query removes information from a database?

What keyword wraps the data that you would like to insert in an INSERT query?
If you want to apply a second condition to your statement where both statements must be true, what keyword would you use between the conditions?
To sort your results by a column name, what keyword would you use before the column name?
What function would you use to round all numbers down?
What function would you use to round all values up?
What function can you use to compare dates?
Which of the following is NOT true about the SQL transaction control statements?

options.text: Each DML statement is automatically committed.
The COMMIT statement ends the current transaction and makes all data changes permanent.
The ROLLBACK statement ends the transaction and discards all the pending data changes.

If you are only retrieving one column’s values, what keyword can you add before the column name to only return unique values?
Which SQL statement is used to create a table in a database?
Which of the following is not true about creating constraints?

options.text: Constraints are defined using the CREATE CONSTRAINT statement.
They are created at the same time when the table is created.
They could be created after the table is created.
All the constraints are stored in data dictionary.

questions.statement: A systematic collection of data stored in a central location is known as?
Which of the following is true about a role?

options.text: A role is a named group of related privileges.
It can be it can be created and assigned to a user.
It can be revoked from a user.

questions.statement: Which type of database management system represents relations using tables?
What is a composite key?

options.text: its is a key that is defined as the primary key in another table
it is a key that uniquely identifies a record in a database
its is an optional key and allows null values
it is a primary key that consists of more than one field that uniquely identifies a record

questions.statement: Which of the following is not YES regarding ER modeling.

options.text: ER models act as non technical communication tools
ER models increase the database developer's productivity
ER models can be converted into a database
ER models waste the database developer's time

questions.statement: What command is used to permanently remove a record from a database table?
Which of the following is a valid aggregate function.
Wildcards are

options.text: use characters such as $ to perform pattern matches
use characters such as % to perform single character matching

questions.statement: Which of the following SQL statements will generate an error when executed.

options.text: create database if not exists students

questions.statement: Which of the following scripts will run successfully?

options.text: SELECT `customer name` FROM customers WHERE cat_id = 12 ORDER BY cat_id;
SELECT `customer name` FROM customers ORDER BY zone WHERE cat_id = 12;

questions.statement: The SQL WHERE clause:

options.text: limits the column data that are returned.
limits the row data are returned.
Both A and B are correct.

questions.statement: Which of the following is the original purpose of SQL?

options.text: To specify the syntax and semantics of SQL data definition language
To specify the syntax and semantics of SQL manipulation language

questions.statement: The wildcard in a WHERE clause is useful when?

options.text: An exact match is necessary in a SELECT statement.
An exact match is not possible in a SELECT statement.
An exact match is necessary in a CREATE statement.
An exact match is not possible in a CREATE statement.

questions.statement: What type of join is needed when you wish to include rows that do not have matching values?
What type of join is needed when you wish to return rows that do have matching values?
Which of the following is true concerning a procedure?

options.text: You do not create them with SQL.
They do not need to have a unique name.
They include procedural and SQL statements.
They are the same thing as a function.

questions.statement: A CASE SQL statement is which of the following?

options.text: A way to establish an IF-THEN-ELSE in SQL.
A way to establish a data definition in SQL.
A way to establish a loop in SQL.

questions.statement: Which of the following statements is true concerning routines and triggers?

options.text: Both have to be called to operate.
Both are stored in the database.

questions.statement: A view is which of the following?

options.text: A virtual table that can be accessed via SQL commands
A virtual table that cannot be accessed via SQL commands
A base table that cannot be accessed via SQL commands
A base table that can be accessed via SQL commands

questions.statement: The SQL keyword(s) \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ is used with wildcards.
Which of the following is one of the basic approaches for joining tables?
Which of the following statements is true concerning subqueries?

options.text: Involves the use of an inner and outer query.
Does not start with the word SELECT.
Cannot return the same result as a query that is not a subquery.

questions.statement: The command to eliminate a table from a database is:
Which of the following is the correct order of keywords for SQL SELECT statements?
Which of the following is a correlated subquery?

options.text: Uses the result of an inner query to determine the processing of an outer query.
Uses the result of an outer query to determine the processing of an inner query.
Uses the result of an inner query to determine the processing of an inner query.
Uses the result of an outer query to determine the processing of an outer query.

    SELECT CUSTOMER_T. CUSTOMER_ID, ORDER_T. CUSTOMER_ID, NAME, ORDER_ID FROM
    CUSTOMER_T,ORDER_T WHERE CUSTOMER_T. CUSTOMER_ID = ORDER_T. CUSTOMER_ID​
How many tables may be included with a join?
Which of the following is valid SQL for an Index?
Embedded SQL is which of the following?

options.text: Hard-coded SQL statements in a trigger.
Hard-coded SQL statements in a procedure.
Hard-coded SQL statements in a program language such as Java.
The process of making an application capable of generating specific SQL code on the fly.

questions.statement: A UNION query is which of the following?

options.text: Combines the output from no more than two queries and does not include the same number of columns.
Combines the output from multiple queries and must include the same number of columns.
Combines the output from no more than two queries and must include the same number of columns.
Combines the output from multiple queries and does not include the same number of columns.

questions.statement: Which of the following is true concerning triggers?

options.text: They have an event, condition, and action.
You do not create them with SQL.
They execute against only some applications that access a database.
They cannot cascade (cause another trigger to fire).

questions.statement: In an SQL SELECT statement querying a single table, according to the SQL-92 standard the asterisk (\*) means that:

options.text: all columns of the table are to be returned.
all records meeting the full criteria are to be returned.
all records with even partial criteria met are to be returned.
None of the above is correct.

The SQL keyword BETWEEN is used:
A subquery in an SQL SELECT statement:

options.text: can only be used with two tables.
can always be duplicated by a join.
has a distinct form that cannot be duplicated by a join.
has a distinct form that cannot be duplicated by a join.

questions.statement: The SQL -92 wildcards are \_\_\_\_ and \_\_\_\_ .
The Microsoft Access wildcards are \_\_\_\_ and \_\_\_\_ .
To define what columns should be displayed in an SQL SELECT statement:

options.text: use FROM to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after SELECT.
use USING to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after SELECT.
use SELECT to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after USING.
use USING to name the source table(s) and list the columns to be shown after WHERE.

questions.statement: \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ was adopted as a national standard by ANSI in 1992.
The benefits of a standard relational language include which of the following?

options.text: Increased dependence on a single vendor

questions.statement: Find the SQL statement below that is equal to the following: SELECT NAME FROM CUSTOMER WHERE STATE = 'VA';

options.text: SELECT NAME IN CUSTOMER WHERE STATE IN ('VA');
SELECT NAME IN CUSTOMER WHERE STATE = 'VA';
SELECT NAME FROM CUSTOMER WHERE STATE IN ('VA');
SELECT NAME IN CUSTOMER WHERE STATE = 'V';

questions.statement: DBMS provides insulation between program and data. This is referred to as \_\_\_\_\_\_\_
Which of the following is NOT a typical DBMS functionality?

options.text: Manage the user interface of database application
Define a particular database in terms of its data types, structures and constraints
Processing and sharing by a set of concurrent users and application programs

questions.statement: Which of the following is NOT one of the three phases for Database Design phase?

Use what to remove spaces from the beginning and end of the string value?
SELECT MAX(price)FROM    PRODUCT will return how many rows?

options.text: As many rows that are in the table
